description:
In this post-apocalyptic sci-fi story, humanity has been devastated by the bizarre, giant humanoids known as the Titans. Little is known about where they came from or why they are bent on consuming mankind. Seemingly unintelligent, they have roamed the world for years, killing everyone they see. For the past century, what's left of man has hidden in a giant, three-walled city. People believe their 50-meter-high walls will protect them from the Titans, but the sudden appearance of an immense Titan is about to change everything.

(Source: Kodansha USA)

Note: Includes 2 extra chapters.
synonyms: ผ่าพิภพไททัน

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Acrobatics
tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

node.description: [Official Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/isayamahazime/) After graduating from Oita Prefectural Hitarinkou High School, he matriculated in the cartoon design program of the cartoon arts department at Kyushu Designer Gakuin. After graduating, he moved to Tokyo and started drawing his manga works. In 2006, he applied for the Magazine Grand Prix known as MGP promoted by Kodansha Ltd. and his work [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/85420/Attack-on-Titan-Volume-0/) was given the "Fine Work" award. Originally, he offered his work to the Weekly Shonen Jump department at Shueisha, where he was advised to modify his style and story to be more suitable for Weekly Shonen Jump. He declined and instead, decided to take it to the Weekly Shonen Magazine department at Kodansha Ltd. In 2008, he applied for the 80th Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award, where his work ["Heart Break One"]( was given the Special Encouragement Award. His other work "orz" was chosen as a selected work in the 81st Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award. In 2009, his first serialized work _[Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/53390/Attack-on-Titan/)_ appeared in Bessatsu Shonen Magazine, a monthly magazine. It later was awarded the Shonen category of the 35th Kodansha Manga Award in 2011.

**Doujin Circle:** Nobita Graph (ノビタグラフ)

[Blog](http://ishigana3333.blog.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohei_nagashius)

He was previously an assistant to [Tatsuki Fujimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119917/Tatsuki-Fujimoto) and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Katou)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_tatsuyaendo_)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pawel_dybala)
Besides translation, he also does lectures and research at the Jagiellonian University in Kraków. Works with publishers J.P.Fantastica and Egmont Poland.
Shintarou Kawakubo is a manga editor affiliated with Kodansha.
Claudia Peter is a Japanese to German translator, who also works as a professor on translation and interpretation at the university.
